title: Why do people on boards hate Darius?
body:
He's not op, at best he gets fed in lane and attempts to end the game fast but can't do that well anymore(ult nerf). Every time I say he needs a buff or a change to his kit to be more healthy for both sides I get told he's fine or he doesn't deserve a buff because he's broken when fed.

Who isn't broken when fed? 

Why has Riot given Darius nothing yet? 

Why do people of boards hate Darius with an absolute burning passion?

replies.body:
I think the main reason is that there is nothing on Darius's kit that is dodgeable or meaningfully outplayed. When Darius is strong, you can't get near him without dying.

Likewise, there's very little Darius can do to outplay hit opponents. When he is weak, he can't get near his opponents.

I'm overstating both of these a bit, but that's more or less what's going on there I think. There's a lot of cool stuff about Darius, like his steeply ramping in-combat threat and a repeatable true-damage execution ultimate. But the way everything is currently set, he leads to a bit of a binary experience of "he just killed me over and over again and there was nothing I could do :(," or "Wait... there was a Darius in that game?"

Zyra isn't overloaded. She does the exact same thing in the exact same way as any other utility mage. The only slightly unique things about her are the plants and the passive, and the plants tend to just do the exact same thing as standard nukes, and usually in the exact same way too. If she's overloaded, then I'm going to say that everyone else except Annie, Warwick and Galio is too.

People circlejerk about the CertainlyT thing way too much. If Darius and Zyra are supposed to be overloaded now just because CertainlyT made them, I think the community needs to sit down and try to decide what exactly they want that term to mean.
I'm saying that 90% of Zyra's I see use it purely as a disengage or engage for the damage and potential knockup. i.e. most don't bother throwing out plants first.

A. They suck. Tell this to whatever Zyra players you know loudly and often. 

B. No, really, they suck. This is not a kit issue, it is a "players are bad" issue. It's like if people playing Galio used their W after their Q.

C. Even if points A and B weren't true, it wouldn't mean the kit would be overloaded. Having the ability to use abilities in slightly different situations for non-optimal rewards is not overloaded. It's a facet of the vast majority of kits. Overloaded requires that it function in many heavily different scenarios because of a wealth of mechanics.

D. There is also a short time when you can throw plants after the ult and get the buff. If people are doing this, then disregard points A and B.

> I wouldn't exactly call Darius overloaded. He has a pretty standard amount of things in his kit. He's poorly designed if anything. I wouldn't call Zyra overloaded either, or poorly designed.

Dot that stacks, scales,  and buffs his ulti, aoe that applies the dot, slow that doubles as an auto attack reset, hard cc with passive armor pen, and repeatable true damage ult, as Stashu said. 

Compared to Zyra, who has: revenge passive, 3 aoe's (small circle, line, big circle) turrets, melee and ranged,, snare, and knock-up.

Pretty sure Darius has the most overloaded kit of all the champs we currently have, with perhaps not as big a gap compared to Zyra, but compared to, say, Maokai, he's got a shedload of stuff.

Maokai: infinite sustain, unreal base attack speed, every ability nukes, has aoe percent damage reduction that also absorbs damage to nuke you with, has freaking untargetability, percent max hp damage, a targeted gapcloser, and a knockback.

I mean, holy wtf overloaded kit!? Maokai must be the most overloaded champion in the game.

Seriously though, you can make this argument about anyone. If you just list kit elements, you can make almost anyone sounds overloaded or OP. I

And seriously, if you are going to use that argument, pick someone other than Maokai. Maokai does most things well nowadays. He deals with all situations quite well. That's something I'd call overloaded much more readily than I would call Darius' kit overloaded.

Darius nukes at close range, and is worthless outside of it. His close range prowess is not due to any specific mechanics. It is due to numbers. Numerically, no one can outtrade him. The only differentiating mechanics he has are the ult and the pull, and that is not enough for me to call him overloaded. He does 1-2 things well and fails at most other things. That lack of potential is not what being overloaded is. Thresh and Yasuo are overloaded because when they are strong, they are the best at almost everything. Darius has many things he is terrible at, no matter how strong he is. His weaknesses are not lowered or mediated by any part of his kit.

Zyra has skillshot nukes and some CC. It's the same as Lux, Ori, or any other utility mage. There is nothing significant differentiating her from any of them. The turrets mean pretty much nothing different from any standard nuke. You use them in exactly the same way and they do exactly the same thing as any other nuke. That's not overloaded, it's a different way of doing the exact same thing. Overloaded means you have more options, not the same option wearing a slightly different hat.

CertainlyT has produced a few overloaded champions for sure. Zyra and Darius are not among them.
Darius is overloaded? He's a short-range fighter with stacking DoTs and a true damage ultimate that interacts with said stacks. There isn't that much else to him, really.

He's a no sustain, no mobility, 'I die or you die' champion. Darius isn't like that, he isn't here to jump around like a monkey, he's here to fight and kill, or die trying.

I disagree with this. He is in fact, one of the best champs to be able to outplay, or get outplayed.

When you play against Darius you think, how can I bait out his hook, or his Q. Can I lead him into a careful jungle gank? I'm squishy. How much can I poke Darius before I have to dodge his grab. How much mana does Darius have left?

Compare that to pre-nerf  Gnar.

Hmmm... I'm playing against Gnar. I cannot trade with him because his W is too strong. If I poke him down he'll just heal it back as Mega Gnar. I cannot set up a jungle gank because he'll bounce away. I can't all-in him because he can either bounce away, or just beat me anyways, because he does too much damage.

I guess I'll just hang back and out CS him, while dodging his boomerang. I'll outscale him, right?
People of the boards hate everything and everyone.

It is not just people on the boards... most in general hate Darius because of his stupid strong lane strength that destroys most squishier opponents. The biggest offender though is his ult. Not only does it do true damage but it also scales incredibly well with attack damage and since he has a free built in armor pen passive in his kit trying to build armor against him feels pointless.

Since he already has an overpowering lane phase there really is no way to buff his late game without making him a major problem. If they nerfed his lane phase he would never be able to make it to the late game and be effective. To put it simply Darius has always been balancing on a knifes edge any change they try to make will either push his power over the top or bury him in the ground.

Darius is yet another annoying bruiser who wins or loses based on stats.  You don't outplay Darius and Darius doesn't outplay you.

Needs a rework.
He's either going to wreck you or get wrecked by you. He dominates just about any melee and is dinner for just about any ranged champion. He needs a rework

Garen was at release (and to some extent still is) "easy mode".  His passive allows him to recover from bad trades faster than his opponent.  Only one of his skills can "miss" (his spin), and even that is really easy to do well with.  Plus he can build tanky and still deal respectable damage.  And he had an execute.
When he came out, he was overwhelmed by players who could suddenly do really well on him (because of how easy he was to play well), which often led to a lot of immature trash talking, misplaced ego, and so forth.
On top of that, as I mentioned, he had an execute.  And from what I've seen so far, champions with an execute style ability tend to attract players who play very selfishly.  These are the type of people that whine about "he stole my kill" in a team game.

Darius arrived, and really was Garen Mk 2.  With incredibly strong trading potential, and massive snowballing, he was a shoe-in for unskilled players to do well on.  His bleed meant that against clueless opponents, you'd wind up steamrolling the lane, simply because they'd bleed a while, then trade again (and get stacks of bleed again), quickly leading them to be low health.  Plus, even more so than Garen, he had a major execute mechanic.  However, unlike Garen, his included a reset (further encouraging KS whining).
